definition: feeling better/to be more at ease
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
unpleasant/hard to take

sentences.english: Is it hard to see your friends live with Alzheimer's?
sentences.chinese: 見到朋友們得了老年癡呆症，您不好受吧？

sentences.english: Plus IDA's coldness, red fruits in the mind is very owe right now.
sentences.chinese: 加上艾達的冷言冷語，紅果心裏很欠好受。

sentences.english: If your mother find your trouser broked, you will get suffering.
sentences.chinese: 要是你母親看見你的褲子破了，你有好受的。

sentences.english: If I am right, she should feel better if she drinks this.
sentences.chinese: 如果我想的沒錯，喝了這個會讓她好受點兒。

sentences.english: He felt better after sweating himself by taking APC.
sentences.chinese: 喫過阿司匹林發了一身汗後，他感到好受多了。

sentences.english: It eats in her to stand idly by.
sentences.chinese: 站在一旁無所事事，這使她很不好受。

sentences.english: He felt much better after he opened his heart to her.
sentences.chinese: 他向她訴衷腸後心裏感到好受多了。

sentences.english: His father warned him that he would raise the devil if his grades did not improve.
sentences.chinese: 他父親警告他說，再考不到好分，就有他好受的了。

sentences.english: If you think they're just going to roll over - you've got another thing coming. " - Kobe Bryant."
sentences.chinese: 如果你認爲他們只是想翻身，那麼將有你好受的。

sentences.english: He couldn't stand many more paroxysms like the last one.
sentences.chinese: 象上次那樣的劇痛，他已經沒有多回好受了。

sentences.english: Smokers might get a future reprieve on thedamage that cigarettes do to their lungs.
sentences.chinese: 吸菸者也許能令他們飽受煙毒困擾的肺部好受一些了。

sentences.english: Perhaps a change of air would make her feel better.
sentences.chinese: 也許到那裏換換空氣會使她好受些。

sentences.english: If you are sick you could say, I feel as sick as a dog.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真的不好受的話，你可以說我病得象條狗一樣。

sentences.english: You know the bitter taste of living under somebody else's thumb.
sentences.chinese: 你們知道，寄人籬下的生活是不好受的。

sentences.english: A man doesn't feel right, battening on his in-laws .
sentences.chinese: 一個男人要靠姻親過活是不好受的。

sentences.english: Oh, I give you a bolus of narcotic injection which let you feel better.
sentences.chinese: 我先給你一針止痛針讓你好受些。

to have an easy time/(feel) well

comfortable/at ease

taste/flavor/feeling
to feel wronged/to cause sb to feel wronged/grievance
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate

to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected

unwell/feeling ill/to feel uncomfortable/uneasy
